metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5148 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Xen 4.4.x, when running on an ARM system and "handling an unknown system register access from 64-bit userspace," returns to an instruction of the trap handler for kernel space faults instead of an instruction that is associated with faults in 64-bit userspace, which allows local guest users to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly gain privileges via a crafted process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xen-utils-common - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
xenstore-utils - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
